utterances: Premier Wen will be there.

Representing Barack Obama will be a close friend and an adviser, Valerie Jarrett.

Geithner still has not been confirmed, and it's considered a little rude to be out in public until you actually are confirmed.
And with Valerie Jarrett being there, is there a feeling that if you can get her ear, you're getting the ear of the president?
Yes.

Anything that she can do to let people know that there's a sense from the new administration that they do have things under control - they are working hard, they have the stimulus plan working its way through Congress, and they're trying to do everything they can to get the economy going again - I think that will send a very important message.
What of substance do you expect to come from this meeting?
For John Cruden, the new role means coming home to a place where he worked as a career lawyer for 20 years.
Cruden's been around long enough to have supervised the Exxon Valdez spill case, a record setter until the Deepwater Horizon exploded in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010.
That's pretty heavy.
Now, you write the Romance 101 column in the Student Life newspaper at Washington University.
And last week, you wrote about how to survive a turkey drop, and this comes from experience, right?
Yes, very true.
I was turkey dropped my freshman year.
Came home for that first Thanksgiving break, and we saw each other and my boyfriend just said I can't do this anymore; the distance is too hard.
And I don't mean to rub this in, but he was in high school and you were in college and he dumped you?
He was.
He was.
He was still a senior in high school, so that one hurt even a little bit more than, I think, the regular breakup.
Well, it turns out this isn't just a college phenomenon.
Thanksgiving is perfect for breakups of all ages.
So, who better to turn to than relationship and sex advice guru Dan Savage, who joins us from Seattle.
Hey, Dan.
Hey, Robert.
So, what is it about Thanksgiving that makes it a common time to breakup?
Well, for grownups, it's not that it's the first time you're laying eyes on each other after heading off to college.
For grownups, it's the anticipation of being stuck for three or four more months.

Because if you don't break up now at Thanksgiving or before Thanksgiving, you're a cad if you break up around Christmas and then there's New Year's, and you can't dump somebody right around New Year's.
And then quickly after that, if you don't jump on it, is Valentine's Day.
So, really, Thanksgiving is when you have to pull the trigger if you're not willing to tough it out through February.
Yeah, because you would have brought them home to the family at that point for maybe Christmas or Hanukkah or something like that, and that just makes it all worse.
And, God forbid, if their birthday should fall some time between November and February, then you're really stuck.
(Soundbite of laughter)
There's a whole physics over this.
So, okay.
Let's do it this way.
Let's say we're dating, Dan, and you've decided that it's Thanksgiving and we've got to end this radio relationship.
So, you're turkey dropping me.
I'm actually bad at the turkey drop.
I had a turkey drop that was coming and I fled the state.
Dan Savage, I'd probably do the same.
Pure wimp are you, Robert, (unintelligible) should we be dating.
So, Carly MacLeod, do you have the guts to break up with me over the radio?
Show me how it's done.

I mean, the standard formula from all the different stories I've heard - I talked to a few friends before writing the article - pull you aside and I'd say, you know, it's been a lot of fun but I really have my own life going at school and I don't know if I have room for you to be part of that.
I can change.
I mean, the distance isn't going to change, though, and that's the big thing.
There's always next summer.
I mean, really, we can prolong this a little bit.
But think of all the stuff we'll be able to do at our different schools and different lives because of this.

I think she did really well, yeah.

Dan Savage writes the syndicated Savage Love Column.

Lawmakers here say they are on the verge of a deal to close the state's massive budget deficit.
